website_summaries.verdict: New Balance 1500 v6 is a road racing flat designed to help the runners achieve their optimal performance goals. The shoe features a race day-inspired designed and advanced technologies that provide quicker rebound and support for long-distance running.
pros: Many purchasers noted that the New Balance 1500 v6 is comfortable
The shoe fits true to size, based on some reviews
A couple of buyers said the shoe is lightweight
Some users mentioned that it offers a better fit than its predecessor
A wearer is pleased with the stability provided by the shoe
Several consumers commented that it is also good for casual walks
People liked the stylish design of the shoe
cons: A tester reported that the shoe’s outsole is not supportive enough
It is comfortable but not good for racing, said a runner

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe for the price
customer_reviews.text: I liked the fact that the shoe is light on the foot while running and provides basic support to the various areas of the feet as it strikes the hard surface while in motion. It provides a slight bounce while running I would have preferred more. However, no shoe will ever be perfect but this is overall a good shoe for the price and it provides additional nighttime advance warning to alert drivers due to its distinctive color.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits too large in the toe.
customer_reviews.text: I have worn the 1500v3, v4 and v5 shoes all in a 10, they were a perfect fit. This shoe was roughly a 1/4 -1/3 inch too long, so I ordered the 9.5s. The shoe is a little snug in the mid-foot. Also, it is harder to make cuts as the shoe isn't as secure as the v4 or v5 shoes were. They are light and comfortable though. Plus I have gotten plenty of compliments on the new color scheme.
customer_reviews.author: Tennis

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes as always
customer_reviews.text: I put in ~20 miles a week on varying terrain and have been running in these shoes (or variations on the V number) for the last 3 years. They are the best mid-distance neutral shoes I have found for medium-width feet.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Expected more from New Balance
customer_reviews.text: The heel slips way too much. I'm going to get blisters every time I use them. Not ideal for someone with Achilles bone spurs. Positives: The sole is rigid and allows for springy strides, traction is great, the heel to toe drop is ideal at 6mm. The forefoot and midfoot feel securely locked in. Negatives: If the heel cupping were better and didn't tear my feet up, it would be a decent shoe. The heel cup they have on the fresh foam cruz v1 is great, never had any issues with it. It looks like they have something similar in the t2/boa version of this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Berk

customer_reviews.title: The Best Race Shoe for People with WIDE feet
customer_reviews.text: I am a marathon runner with very wide feet. I'm not tiny nor super fast, 165lbs and 3:08 marathoner. The 1500 line is the best shoe i've been able to find for races that accommodates wide feet. I train in the Brooks Ghost and the new balance 1080, both size 12 4e. I have been very happy with the 1500 v5 and now the v6. the v6 is a little more airy, but has same fit. I expect to use it to try an qualify for boston again.
customer_reviews.author: serrulate

customer_reviews.text: not for everyday wear. They get dirty easy. overpriced. I paid $53 now they are selling them for double. Wont buy again

customer_reviews.text: 14 W - is super narrow in the arch. Unless you have feet shaped like a banana you are not going to like them.

customer_reviews.text: This might be the best racing shoe out there. I used the old 1500 for a long time and thought it was ok but this shoe is amazing. The fit is better, the way the shoe feels great. Will buy again.

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe but needs a redesign
customer_reviews.text: I really like these shoes but they do require some heel tape. The shoe hugs the back of your heel and it is not soft there.

customer_reviews.title: Great workout/running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit. Super comfortable. Definitely buying another pair in the future
customer_reviews.author: David Poor

customer_reviews.title: Solid Update but Fits Narrow
customer_reviews.text: I've ran with the previous models of this shoe. It seems like, with each revision, the shoe fits more and more narrow. This was my go-to shoe, now I can't run with it anymore. My feet seem to like wide toe box shoes. Overall, it's a fast lightweight race shoe. These shoes aren't for the slow runner.
customer_reviews.author: Joel G. Gaspar

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite shoes ever
customer_reviews.text: First, let's acknowledge what this shoe is a racing flat, track, or fast tempo shoe. It's not an everyday, long mileage trainer. But it is excellent at what it does. I wasn't sure about support in a racing-type shoe, as I don't overpronate, but I found it gives me very good support while running very fast. It is just supportive enough to make me feel stable underfoot, but in a very light shoe. I find myself looking forward to 400m to 1000m repeats just because of this shoe. It's a total winner.
customer_reviews.author: txreview

customer_reviews.title: Hilighter Yellow
customer_reviews.text: Great fit. Despite them being men’s I ordered them anyway. The color is nice and bright like hilighter yellow.
customer_reviews.author: jazzyfatnasty

product_meta.title: New Balance Men's 1500v6 Running Shoe
product_meta.description: Lightweight. Aggressive. Adjustable. Built and designed for competitive road runners seeking a fast ride and reliable support, the 1500v6 men's runner brings an updated look to a classic series that's inspired by race day. Plus, a newly formulated REVlite midsole provides underfoot cushion that's designed for a quicker rebound to give you speedy mile-after-mile support.
